perturbation.original_text: This Distribution Agreement (the "Agreement") is entered into by and between American Express Incentive Services, L.L.C., a Missouri limited liability company ("AEIS"), and its Reseller, Schoolpop, Inc., a Delaware corporation ("Schoolpop").
perturbation.changed_text: This Distribution Agreement (the "Agreement") is entered into by and between American Express Incentive Services, L.L.C., a Missouri limited liability company ("AEIS"), and its Distributor, Schoolpop, Inc., a Delaware corporation ("Schoolpop").
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'Reseller' and 'Distributor' are used interchangeably, but without clearly defining them as the same entity. This could lead to confusion regarding the scope of Schoolpop's responsibilities and rights. Especially in scenarios of exclusivity or liability.

perturbation.original_text: Schoolpop shall have the exclusive right to resell Cards in the NPO Marketplace. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Schoolpop shall fund from AEIS a minimum of $52,000,000 of Cards (the "Guaranteed Minimum") in each Contract Year in order to maintain the exclusive right to sell Cards in the NPO Marketplace.
perturbation.changed_text: Schoolpop shall have the exclusive right to retail Cards in the NPO Marketplace. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Schoolpop shall fund from AEIS a minimum of $52,000,000 of Cards (the "Guaranteed Minimum") in each Contract Year in order to maintain the exclusive right to sell Cards in the NPO Marketplace.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'resell' to 'retail' creates ambiguity. While 'resell' implies selling to other businesses or intermediaries, 'retail' usually means selling directly to consumers. Using these terms inconsistently without defining how they apply to Schoolpop's activities can lead to disputes over permitted sales channels.

perturbation.original_text: AEIS reserves the right to assess a penalty, ("Card Inventory Penalty") of sixteen and one-half cents ($0.165) per Card for such difference as detailed in Examples 1 and 2 below.
perturbation.changed_text: AEIS reserves the option to assess a penalty, ("Card Inventory Penalty") of sixteen and one-half cents ($0.165) per Card for such difference as detailed in Examples 1 and 2 below.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'right' to 'option' implies that AEIS can decide whether or not to assess the penalty at its own discretion and opens the door to uncertainty and potential disputes, as the conditions under which the penalty will be applied are no longer strictly defined.
